Day 1 - as it happened

By James Bithell

A blow-by-blow account of the opening day of Roses 2008

Roses - Preview

The tension is mounting as York prepare to defend the Carter-James Trophy away at Lancaster, beginning on Friday.

Lancaster AU President excited for start of competition

James Marenghi, Lancaster's AU President, is eager to get underway

Carter bullish on victory prospects

AU President Jo Carter is confident that York can retain the Roses away from home

Fixtures / Results

Nouse at Roses 2008

Get the latest comment, analysis and gossip from the Nouse team in Lancaster.

Matthew Jeynes

It seems that exceptional circumstances are preventing me from sticking to my strict 'University only' rule on content for this column. Anyone tuned in to BBC 1 from 3pm to 5pm on Saturday will know why. That's right - England rugby.

York defeat Newcastle to earn promotion in League playoff

In a hastily organised playoff match, York's first team triumphed over Newcastle in a 2-1 away victory that re-secures their promotion in the BUSA League.

York continue BUSA Plate run after dominating performance

A place in the quarter-final awaits York Rugby Men's 1st after a confident win over the University of Lincoln in the second round of the BUSA Plate.

Oxford women forfeit rugby encounter

Oxford was forced to forfeit the game after being unable to replace an injured forward.

Alex Lacy elected AU President in close race

Late on Friday night, in a remarkably close race, Boxing Club President Alex Lacy was elected to be next year's AU President. "I was absolutely gobsmacked," he later tells Nouse. "I didn't see it coming."

Sports Centre set for PS1m full refurbishment

The Sports Centre has announced plans for the development and refurbishment of campus sporting facilities. A potential figure exceeding PS1,000,000 is to be invested in crucial upgrades to the Sports Centre and its amenities.

York storm to fourth straight Varsity victory

By James Bithell

York's sports teams achieved their fourth successive win against York St John in the annual Varsity competition since the tournament's inception in 2005.

Men's Rugby 1sts: York 16-8 St John

By James Bithell

In a scrappy game an abler York University side were eventually able to triumph over their Varsity rivals, but they made very hard work of it.

Men's Hockey 1sts: St John snatch point with second half comeback

By James Bithell

A pulsating encounter on the JLD Astroturf saw York St John snatch a deserved late equalizer in a dramatic finish to complete a remarkable second-half comeback.

Men's Dodgeball: York 3-0 St John

When the two sides lined up on either side of the dodgeball court at the end of Wednesday afternoon, the physical advantage was clearly with York St John.

Netball 1sts: York 35-30 St John

By James Bithell

Amid joyous scenes, York's netballers rounded off a fine Varsity afternoon with victory over St John's 1sts in a pulsating and physical encounter.

York 1sts in BUSA knockout victory

By James Bithell

York got their BUSA Plate challenge up and running after a hard fought but ultimately comfortable victory over Scottish opponents Stirling University 2nds.

Colin Walker, York City FC's new talisman

Colin Walker is in a buoyant mood. A self-styled loudmouth, a larger-than-life football personality, the York City gaffer has quite literally been round the world in an unusual career.

Matthew Jeynes

acilities, fixtures and funding: issues to be faced by the next AU President.

Jo Carter - AU President

Wednesday February 13: the fourth annual Varsity competition and a fourth York win. Four out of four, and yet still some people are not happy.

York victorious in 6-a-side cricket encounter

York completed the last of many comfortable victories on Varsity day with a 4 wicket defeat of St John in the Men's Indoor Cricket.

Men's 1sts Hockey: York 2-2 St John

A dramatic finale on the JLD astroturf saw York St John snatch a deserved late equaliser in and end-to-end finish.

Netball 1sts: York 35-30 St John

Amid joyous scenes, York's netballers rounded off a fine Varsity afternoon with victory over their local rivals St. John in a pulsating and physical encounter.

Badminton Men's 1sts - York 4-5 St John

St John's claimed a 5-4 match victory during an epic 3 hour clash in the Main Hall.

Football Men's 3rds - York 2-1 St John

The York Uni Men's 3rd XI put in a dogged display this afternoon to see off a spirited St John's team who threatened for much of the game but were unable to convert their chances.

Football Men's 4ths - York 4-0 St John

In the second of two Varsity football matches being played today, the York fourth team ran out a comfortable 4 - 0 victory.

St John clinch surprise rowing victory

On the River Ouse today, York's senior men triumphed by a canvas while the novices were ousted by a York St John novice four.

Men's Basketball 1sts - York 65-50 St John

York Men's 1sts basketball team powered to a comprehensive victory over York St. John this afternoon.

York outclassed in outdoor Ultimate Frisbee

This morning's Ultimate Frisbee open match saw York run ragged by a much stronger Lancaster side, with a final score of 14 - 5
